message_1: In the Centipede Game, two players play a game where they take turns either stopping the game or continuing it. The game is played for a total of 10 turns. The game continues until one player decides to end it. If the game ends at turn k, the two players split $2^(k-1) equally. What is the highest payout that player 1 can get if both players play optimally?
